observation:
[{'url': 'https://www.rcdriver.com/reviews/', 'content': "Tamiya Squash Van GF-02. Greg Vogel February 28, 2024 RC Driver Videos. There's a lot of excitement for the new Tamiya Squash Van GF-02 found here: https://bit.ly/3RmjEWF It's a new chassis that fits nicely between the short wheelbase GF-01 and the longer G6-01. Could this be a good performing 4×4 fun truck …."}, {'url': 'https://www.rcsuperstore.com/blog/bushed-vs-brushless-rc-motor-7-reasons-to-go-brushless-with-your-next-rc-vehicle/', 'content': 'Brushless RC motors, by contrast, are renowned for their durability. With fewer moving parts and no motor brushes to wear out, they can withstand extensive use and abuse without sacrificing performance. This durability is a significant advantage for RC enthusiasts who demand reliability. 7. Virtually Maintenance-Free Operation.'}, {'url': 'https://www.thedrive.com/reviews/30220/best-rc-cars', 'content': "The value is literally unbelievable for people who have been in the hobby for years
Brushless, full ball bearings, metal drivetrain, it's a tough little truck
It's fast, does wheelies, will fly off jumps and do all the bashing
Cons
Great basher but not for people who may want to race
Parts are only available online through Amazon or Bezgar's site
At this point, there doesn't seem to be an aftermarket for service parts or modifications
If what you're looking for is big jumps, wheelies, and bashing on a budget, this is your best option. A lot of high-end parts and performance for a modest price
It is really fast but can be upgraded to basically ground-based missile speeds
Cons
Durable enough for a regular RC car but crashing at 75 MPH will break anything
You can't run down to your local hobby shop to buy parts
The advent of relatively affordable and undeniably small GPS-based speed, and G-force data loggers has opened up the hobby to speed running anywhere you have the space. The TC-01 is a very good, if underappreciated platform capable of spec racing or touring car classes
Chassis is capable stock, but can be built up to extremely high levels of performance
Cons
Requires radio, electronics, battery and charger to complete
does not include a full set of bearings, which is frustrating at the price
The Tamiya TC-01 chassis is one of the most underrated and largely ignored platforms on the market. The kit only includes the car and radio, battery, and charger will nearly double the price
Halfway between a modern and vintage buggy so not ideal for racing
Long time hobbyists will love the nostalgia of this buggy and newcomers to RC will love the performance, the realism, and the quality. Best Overall: Traxxas Slash 2WD RTR
Pros
Great performance right out of the box
Repair and upgrade parts are available at most hobby shops
Spec classes are the most affordable and approachable way to get into racing
Cons
While this will jump and do donuts, it is not the best basher
I've owned a Traxxas Slash for a little over two years."}, {'url': 'https://rchobbylab.com/buyers-guide/best-rc-cars/', 'content': "With those key factors covered, let's countdown the 10 best RC cars for 2023! 10. Traxxas Maxx V2 RC Car.
